headers.mt1: The Third Book of Moses, called Leviticus

verses.text:
And the \nd LORD\nd* called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the
tabernacle of the congregation, saying,

Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any
man of you bring an offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*, ye shall bring
your offering of the cattle, \add even\add* of the herd, and of the
flock.

If his offering \add be\add* a burnt sacrifice of the herd,
let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary
will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the
\nd LORD\nd*.

And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering;
and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

And he shall kill the bullock before the \nd LORD\nd*: and the
priests, Aaron’s sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood
round about upon the altar that \add is by\add* the door of the tabernacle
of the congregation.
And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.

And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar,
and lay the wood in order upon the fire:

And the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall lay the parts, the head,
and the fat, in order upon the wood that \add is\add* on the fire which
\add is\add* upon the altar:

But his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the
priest shall burn all on the altar, \add to be\add* a burnt sacrifice,
an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And if his offering \add be\add* of the flocks, \add namely\add*,
of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring
it a male without blemish.

And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before
the \nd LORD\nd*: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall sprinkle his
blood round about upon the altar.

And he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his
fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that \add is\add*
on the fire which \add is\add* upon the altar:

But he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the
priest shall bring \add it\add* all, and burn \add it\add* upon the
altar: it \add is\add* a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire,
of a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the \nd LORD\nd*
\add be\add* of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves,
or of young pigeons.

And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off
his head, and burn \add it\add* on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung
out at the side of the altar:\f + \fr 1.15  \ft wring…: or, pinch off the head with the
nail\f*

And he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast
it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:\f + \fr 1.16 
\ft his feathers: or, the filth thereof\f*

And he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, \add but\add* shall not divide
\add it\add* asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar,
upon the wood that \add is\add* upon the fire: it \add is\add* a burnt
sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And when any will offer a meat offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*,
his offering shall be \add of\add* fine flour; and he shall pour
oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

And he shall bring it to Aaron’s sons the priests: and he shall
take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the
frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the
altar, \add to be\add* an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour
unto the \nd LORD\nd*:

And the remnant of the meat offering \add shall be\add* Aaron’s
and his sons’: \add it is\add* a thing most holy of the offerings
of the \nd LORD\nd* made by fire.

And if thou bring an oblation of a meat offering baken in the
oven, \add it shall be\add* unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled
with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed  with oil.

And if thy oblation \add be\add* a meat offering \add baken\add*
in a pan, it shall be \add of\add* fine flour unleavened, mingled
with oil.\f + \fr 2.5  \ft in a pan: or, on a flat plate, or, slice\f*

Thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it \add is\add*
a meat offering.

And if thy oblation \add be\add* a meat offering \add baken\add*
in the fryingpan, it shall be made \add of\add* fine flour with oil.

And thou shalt bring the meat offering that is made of these things unto the
\nd LORD\nd*: and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall
bring it unto the altar.

And the priest shall take from the meat offering a memorial
thereof, and shall burn \add it\add* upon the altar: \add it is\add*
an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And that which is left of the meat offering \add shall be\add*
Aaron’s and his sons’: \add it is\add* a thing most holy of the offerings
of the \nd LORD\nd* made by fire.

No meat offering, which ye shall bring unto the \nd LORD\nd*,
shall be made with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey,
in any offering of the \nd LORD\nd* made by fire.

As for the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the
\nd LORD\nd*: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet
savour.\f + \fr 2.12  \ft be burnt: Heb. ascend\f*

And every oblation of thy meat offering shalt thou season
with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy
God to be lacking from thy meat offering: with all thine offerings
thou shalt offer salt.

And if thou offer a meat offering of thy firstfruits unto the
\nd LORD\nd*, thou shalt offer for the meat offering of thy firstfruits
green ears of corn dried by the fire, \add even\add* corn beaten
out of full ears.

And thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon: it
\add is\add* a meat offering.

And the priest shall burn the memorial of it, \add part\add*
of the beaten corn thereof, and \add part\add* of the oil thereof, with all the
frankincense thereof: \add it is\add* an offering made by fire unto the
\nd LORD\nd*.

And if his oblation \add be\add* a sacrifice of peace offering,
if he offer \add it\add* of the herd; whether \add it be\add* a male
or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the \nd LORD\nd*.

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and
kill it \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
and Aaron’s sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar
round about.

And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by
fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the
fat that \add is\add* upon the inwards,\f + \fr 3.3  \ft fat: or,
suet\f*

And the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* on them, which
\add is\add* by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the
kidneys, it shall he take away.\f + \fr 3.4  \ft caul…: or, midriff over the liver, and over the
kidneys\f*

And Aaron’s sons shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt
sacrifice, which \add is\add* upon the wood that \add is\add* on the
fire: \add it is\add* an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour
unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the
\nd LORD\nd* \add be\add* of the flock; male or female, he shall
offer it without blemish.

If he offer a lamb for his offering, then shall he offer it
before the \nd LORD\nd*.

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and
kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron’s sons
shall sprinkle the blood thereof round about upon the altar.

And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by
fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*; the fat thereof, \add and\add* the whole
rump, it shall he take off hard by the backbone; and the fat that
covereth the inwards, and all the fat that \add is\add* upon the
inwards,

And the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* upon them, which
\add is\add* by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the
kidneys, it shall he take away.

And the priest shall burn it upon the altar: \add it is\add*
the food of the offering made by fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And if his offering \add be\add* a goat, then he shall offer
it before the \nd LORD\nd*.

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of it, and kill it
before the tabernacle of the congregation: and the sons of Aaron
shall sprinkle the blood thereof upon the altar round about.

And he shall offer thereof his offering, \add even\add* an offering made by
fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the
fat that \add is\add* upon the inwards,

And the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* upon them, which
\add is\add* by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the
kidneys, it shall he take away.

And the priest shall burn them upon the altar: \add it is\add*
the food of the offering made by fire for a sweet savour: all the
fat \add is\add* the \nd LORD’s\nd*.

\add It shall be\add* a perpetual statute for your generations
throughout all your dwellings, that ye eat neither fat nor blood.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a soul shall
sin through ignorance against any of the commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*
\add concerning things\add* which ought not to be done, and shall
do against any of them:

If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin
of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned,
a young bullock without blemish unto the \nd LORD\nd* for a sin offering.

And he shall bring the bullock unto the door of the tabernacle
of the congregation before the 
d LORD
d*; and shall lay his hand
upon the bullock’s head, and kill the bullock before the 
d LORD
d*.

And the priest that is anointed shall take of the bullock’s
blood, and bring it to the tabernacle of the congregation:

And the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle
of the blood seven times before the \nd LORD\nd*, before the vail
of the sanctuary.

And the priest shall put \add some\add* of the blood upon the
horns of the altar of sweet incense before the \nd LORD\nd*, which
\add is\add* in the tabernacle of the congregation; and shall pour
all the blood of the bullock at the bottom of the altar of the burnt
offering, which \add is at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the
congregation.

And he shall take off from it all the fat of the bullock for the sin
offering; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that
\add is\add* upon the inwards,

And the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* upon them, which
\add is\add* by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the
kidneys, it shall he take away,

As it was taken off from the bullock of the sacrifice of peace
offerings: and the priest shall burn them upon the altar of the burnt
offering.

And the skin of the bullock, and all his flesh, with his head,
and with his legs, and his inwards, and his dung,

Even the whole bullock shall he carry forth without the camp
unto a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn him on the
wood with fire: where the ashes are poured out shall he be burnt.\f + \fr 4.12 
\ft without…: Heb. to without the camp\f*\f + \fr 4.12  \ft where…: Heb. at the pouring out of the
ashes\f*

And if the whole congregation of Israel sin through ignorance,
and the thing be hid from the eyes of the assembly, and they have
done \add somewhat against\add* any of the commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*
\add concerning things\add* which should not be done, and are guilty;

When the sin, which they have sinned against it, is known,
then the congregation shall offer a young bullock for the sin, and
bring him before the tabernacle of the congregation.

And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the
head of the bullock before the 
d LORD
d*: and the bullock shall be
killed before the 
d LORD
d*.

And the priest that is anointed shall bring of the bullock’s
blood to the tabernacle of the congregation:

And the priest shall dip his finger \add in some\add* of the
blood, and sprinkle \add it\add* seven times before the \nd LORD\nd*,
\add even\add* before the vail.

And he shall put \add some\add* of the blood upon the horns
of the altar which \add is\add* before the \nd LORD\nd*, that \add is\add*
in the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall pour out all the
blood at the bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which \add is
at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

And he shall take all his fat from him, and burn \add it\add*
upon the altar.

And he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock
for a sin offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an
atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them.

And he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and
burn him as he burned the first bullock: it \add is\add* a sin offering
for the congregation.

When a ruler hath sinned, and done \add somewhat\add* through
ignorance \add against\add* any of the commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*
his God \add concerning things\add* which should not be done, and is
guilty;

Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge;
he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat, and kill
it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before the \nd LORD\nd*: it
\add is\add* a sin offering.

And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering
with his finger, and put \add it\add* upon the horns of the altar
of burnt offering, and shall pour out his blood at the bottom of the
altar of burnt offering.

And he shall burn all his fat upon the altar, as the fat of the
sacrifice of peace offerings: and the priest shall make an atonement
for him as concerning his sin, and it shall be forgiven him.

And if any one of the common people sin through ignorance,
while he doeth \add somewhat against\add* any of the commandments
of the \nd LORD\nd* \add concerning things\add* which ought not to be
done, and be guilty;\f + \fr 4.27  \ft any one: Heb. any soul\f*\f + \fr 4.27 
\ft common…: Heb. people of the land\f*

Or if his sin, which he hath sinned, come to his knowledge:
then he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a female without
blemish, for his sin which he hath sinned.

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering,
and slay the sin offering in the place of the burnt offering.

And the priest shall take of the blood thereof with his finger,
and put \add it\add* upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering,
and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar.

And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat is taken
away from off the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall
burn \add it\add* upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*;
and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.

And if he bring a lamb for a sin offering, he shall bring
it a female without blemish.

And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering,
and slay it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt
offering.

And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering
with his finger, and put \add it\add* upon the horns of the altar
of burnt offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the
bottom of the altar:

And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat of the
lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of the peace offerings; and the
priest shall burn them upon the altar, according to the offerings made by
fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*: and the priest shall make an atonement
for his sin that he hath committed, and it shall be forgiven him.

And if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and \add is\add*
a witness, whether he hath seen or known \add of it;\add* if he do not
utter \add it\add*, then he shall bear his iniquity.

Or if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether \add it be\add*
a carcase of an unclean beast, or a carcase of unclean cattle, or the
carcase of unclean creeping things, and \add if\add* it be hidden
from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.

Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness
\add it be\add* that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid
from him; when he knoweth \add of it\add*, then he shall be guilty.

Or if a soul swear, pronouncing with \add his\add* lips to do
evil, or to do good, whatsoever \add it be\add* that a man shall
pronounce with an oath, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth \add of
it\add*, then he shall be guilty in one of these.

And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these \add things\add*,
that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that \add thing:\add*

And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*
for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb
or a kid of the goats, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make an
atonement for him concerning his sin.

And if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring
for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two
young pigeons, unto the \nd LORD\nd*; one for a sin offering, and the
other for a burnt offering.\f + \fr 5.7  \ft he be…: Heb. his hand cannot reach to the sufficiency of a
lamb\f*

And he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer \add that\add* which
\add is\add* for the sin offering first, and wring off his head from
his neck, but shall not divide \add it\add* asunder:

And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the
side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the
bottom of the altar: it \add is\add* a sin offering.

And he shall offer the second \add for\add* a burnt offering,
according to the manner: and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his
sin which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.\f + \fr 5.10 
\ft manner: or, ordinance\f*

But if he be not able to bring two turtledoves, or two young
pigeons, then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth
part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no
oil upon it, neither shall he put \add any\add* frankincense thereon: for it
\add is\add* a sin offering.

Then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall
take his handful of it, \add even\add* a memorial thereof, and burn
\add it\add* on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire
unto the \nd LORD\nd*: it \add is\add* a sin offering.

And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his
sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and
\add the remnant\add* shall be the priest’s, as a meat offering.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses, saying,

If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy
things of the \nd LORD\nd*; then he shall bring for his trespass
unto the \nd LORD\nd* a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy
estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary,
for a trespass offering:

And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy
thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the
priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram
of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.

And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be
done by the commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*; though he wist \add it\add*
not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.

And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock,
with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the
priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he
erred and wist \add it\add* not, and it shall be forgiven him.

It \add is\add* a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed
against the \nd LORD\nd*.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

If a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the \nd LORD\nd*,
and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in
fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived
his neighbour;\f + \fr 6.2  \ft in fellowship: or, in dealing\f*\f + \fr 6.2 
\ft fellowship: Heb. putting of the hand\f*

Or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and
sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:

Then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall
restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully
gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing
which he found,

Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even
restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part more thereto,
\add and\add* give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day
of his trespass offering.\f + \fr 6.5  \ft in the day…: or, in the day of his being found guilty: Heb. in the day of his
trespass\f*

And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*,
a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass
offering, unto the priest:

And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the \nd LORD\nd*:
and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done
in trespassing therein.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This \add is\add* the law
of the burnt offering: It \add is\add* the burnt offering, because of the
burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the
altar shall be burning in it.\f + \fr 6.9  \ft because…: or, for the
burning\f*

And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen
breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the
fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall
put them beside the altar.

And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments,
and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put
out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt
offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace
offerings.

The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go
out.

And this \add is\add* the law of the meat offering: the sons
of Aaron shall offer it before the \nd LORD\nd*, before the altar.

And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat
offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which
\add is\add* upon the meat offering, and shall burn \add it\add*
upon the altar \add for\add* a sweet savour, \add even\add* the memorial
of it, unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened
bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle
of the congregation they shall eat it.

It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it \add unto them
for\add* their portion of my offerings made by fire; it \add is\add*
most holy, as \add is\add* the sin offering, and as the trespass
offering.

All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it.
\add It shall be\add* a statute for ever in your generations concerning the
offerings of the \nd LORD\nd* made by fire: every one that toucheth
them shall be holy.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses, saying,

This \add is\add* the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall
offer unto the \nd LORD\nd* in the day when he is anointed; the tenth
part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual, half
of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.

In a pan it shall be made with oil; \add and when it is\add*
baken, thou shalt bring it in: \add and\add* the baken pieces of the meat
offering shalt thou offer \add for\add* a sweet savour unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt:
it shall not be eaten.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses, saying,

Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This \add is\add*
the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering
is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the \nd LORD\nd*: it
\add is\add* most holy.

The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy
place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is
sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash
that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.

But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken:
and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and
rinsed in water.

All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it \add is\add*
most holy.

And no sin offering, whereof \add any\add* of the blood is
brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile \add withal\add*
in the holy \add place\add*, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the
fire.

Likewise this \add is\add* the law of the trespass offering: it
\add is\add* most holy.

In the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they
kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle
round about upon the altar.

And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the
fat that covereth the inwards,

And the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* on them, which
\add is\add* by the flanks, and the caul \add that is\add* above the
liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:

And the priest shall burn them upon the altar \add for\add*
an offering made by fire unto the \nd LORD\nd*: it \add is\add* a trespass
offering.

Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be
eaten in the holy place: it \add is\add* most holy.

As the sin offering \add is\add*, so \add is\add* the trespass
offering: \add there is\add* one law for them: the priest that maketh
atonement therewith shall have \add it\add*.

And the priest that offereth any man’s burnt offering, \add even\add*
the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath
offered.

And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is
dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest’s that
offereth it.\f + \fr 7.9  \ft in the pan: or, on the flat plate or,
slice\f*

And every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the
sons of Aaron have, one \add as much\add* as another.

And this \add is\add* the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings,
which he shall offer unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the
sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and
unleavened wafers anointed  with oil, and cakes mingled with oil,
of fine flour, fried.

Besides the cakes, he shall offer \add for\add* his offering
leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.

And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation \add for\add*
an heave offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*, \add and\add* it shall be the
priest’s that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.

And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for
thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not
